sen.j: 北条 幻庵 / 北条 長綱（ほうじょう げんあん / ほうじょう ながつな）は、戦国時代 (日本)の武将である。
sen.e: Genan HOJO/Nagatsuna HOJO was a busho (Japanese military commander) in the Sengoku period.
Genan HOJO/Nagatsuna HOJO was a busho (Japanese military commander) in the Sengoku period (period of warring states).
sen.cmt: Sengoku periodの補足を追加しました。
sen.e: Genan HOJO/Nagatsuna HOJO was a busho (Japanese military commander) in the Sengoku period (period of warring states).
He was born as the third son of Soun HOJO.
He was born as the third son of Soun HOJO.
He was born as the third son of Soun HOJO.
He was a betto (administrator of a Buddhist temple) of Hakone-jinja Shrine.
He was a betto (administrator of a Buddhist temple) of Hakone-jinja Shrine.
He was a betto (administrator of a Buddhist temple) of Hakone-jinja Shrine.
He was also a Inju(the chief of a temple) of Kongoo-in Temple.
He was also an Inju (the chief of a temple) of Kongoo-in Temple.
sen.cmt: a Inju→an Injuに修正、スペース追加しました。
sen.e: He was also an Inju (the chief of a temple) of Kongoo-in Temple.

sen.j: 若い頃に僧籍に入り、箱根権現寺に入寺、のちに京都・三井寺でも修行をした。
sen.e: He entered the priesthood when he was young,entering Hakone gongen (sacred mountain),and did ascetic practices in Mii-dera Temple in Kyoto.
He entered the priesthood when he was young, entering Hakone gongen (sacred mountain), and did ascetic practices in Mii-dera Temple in Kyoto.
sen.cmt: スペース追加しました。
sen.e: He entered the priesthood when he was young, entering Hakone gongen (sacred mountain), and did ascetic practices in Mii-dera Temple in Kyoto.

sen.j: 相模国に戻ってからも還俗せずに、相模中郡と武蔵小机領の領地支配を担当した。
sen.e: He didn't return to secular life after returning to Sagami,and ruled Naka-gun Sagami Province and Musashikodukue territory.
He did not return to secular life after returning to Sagami, and ruled Naka County Sagami Province and Musashi Kozukue territory.
sen.cmt: didn't→did notとし、スペース追加、Naka-gun→Naka County、Musashikodukue→Musashi Kozukueに修正しました。
sen.e: He did not return to secular life after returning to Sagami, and ruled Naka County Sagami Province and Musashi Kozukue territory.

sen.j: 長男の三郎（実子）は夭折し、1569年に武田信玄との駿河国（静岡県）の蒲原城の戦いにおいて子の綱重・長順を失い、北条氏康の7男上杉景虎を養子に迎えて家督を譲り、隠居して幻庵宗哲と号した。
sen.e: He lost his eldest son Saburo (his real son) early,his sonsTsunashige and Nagatoshi in the battle of Kanbara-jo castle in Suruga Province (Shizuoka Prefecture) against Shingen TAKEDA in 1569,therefore,he adopted Kagetora UESUGI,the 7th son of Ujiyasu HOJO,giving him the reigns of the family,and retired,calling himself Soutetsu GENAN.

He lost his eldest son Saburo (his real son) early, his sons Tsunashige and Nagatoshi in the battle of Kanbara-jo Castle in Suruga Province (Shizuoka Prefecture) against Shingen TAKEDA in 1569, therefore, he adopted Kagetora UESUGI, the seventh son of Ujiyasu HOJO, giving him the reigns of the family, and retired, calling himself Genan Sotetsu.
sen.cmt: スペース追加、castleの頭文字を大文字に変更、7th→seventh、Soutetsu GENAN→Genan Sotetsuとしました。
sen.e: He lost his eldest son Saburo (his real son) early, his sons Tsunashige and Nagatoshi in the battle of Kanbara-jo Castle in Suruga Province (Shizuoka Prefecture) against Shingen TAKEDA in 1569, therefore, he adopted Kagetora UESUGI, the seventh son of Ujiyasu HOJO, giving him the reigns of the family, and retired, calling himself Genan Sotetsu.

sen.j: 三郎（景虎）が越後の上杉謙信の養子となった後は、北条氏綱の四男・北条氏堯に小机城を継がせ、家督は氏信（綱重）の子で孫・北条氏隆に継がせた。
sen.e: He made Ujitaka HOJO,the 4th son of Ujitsuna HOJO,succeed Kozukue-jo Castle after Saburo (Kagetora) had been adopted by Kenshin UESUGI,and gave reigns of the family to his grandson Ujitaka HOJI,the son of Ujinobu (Tsunasige).

He made Ujitaka HOJO, the fourth son of Ujitsuna HOJO, succeed Kozukue-jo Castle after Saburo (Kagetora) had been adopted by Kenshin UESUGI, and gave reigns of the family to his grandson Ujitaka HOJO, the son of Ujinobu (Tsunasige).
sen.cmt: スペース追加、4th→fourth、Ujitaka HOJI→Ujitaka HOJOに修正しました。
sen.e: He made Ujitaka HOJO, the fourth son of Ujitsuna HOJO, succeed Kozukue-jo Castle after Saburo (Kagetora) had been adopted by Kenshin UESUGI, and gave reigns of the family to his grandson Ujitaka HOJO, the son of Ujinobu (Tsunasige).

sen.j: 「北条氏所領役帳」によれば、五千貫文を超える家中最大の所領を領有した。
sen.e: According to 'tax ledger (a list of vassals' shoryo) of Hoji family',he had the biggest territory of the family which was more than 5,000kanmon (1,000 kanmon = 10,000 yen).
According to 'the Tax Ledger (a list of vassals' shoryo [territory]) of the Hojo Family,' he had the biggest territory of the family which was more than 5,000 kanmon (1,000 kanmon = 10,000 yen).
sen.cmt: スペース追加、'tax ledger (a list of vassals' shoryo) of Hoji family'→'the Tax Ledger (a list of vassals' shoryo [territory]) of the Hojo Family'に修正、カンマの位置を移動、全角記号を半角に修正しました。
sen.e: According to 'the Tax Ledger (a list of vassals' shoryo [territory]) of the Hojo Family,' he had the biggest territory of the family which was more than 5,000 kanmon (1,000 kanmon = 10,000 yen).

sen.j: 1589年に死去、享年97となるが、（これは北条五代記の記述によるもので、現在の研究では妙法寺記などの同時代の一級史料や手紙などの古文書などと多くの矛盾が見られることから、その信頼性に疑問が持たれており、黒田基樹は幻庵の生年を永正年間と推定している。これが事実とすれば享年は１０年以上若くなる）一説に1501年生まれという説がある。
sen.e: He died in 1589 at the age of 97,(it is based on Hojo Godaiki,however,current studied suggest it has many discrepancy between contemporary first class historical materials such as Myoho-ji ki or ancient documents such as old letters,making its credibility doubtful,and Motoki KURODA dated Genan's birth during the Eisho era (1504-1521). If it is true,his age of death was 10 years younger)one theory has it he was born in 1501.

He died in 1589 at the age of 97, (it is based on the Hojo Godai Ki [Chronicles of the Hojo family through five generations], however, current studied suggest it has many discrepancy between contemporary first class historical materials such as the Myoho-ji Ki [Chronicles of the Myoho-ji Temple] or ancient documents such as old letters, making its credibility doubtful, and Motoki KURODA dated Genan's birth during the Eisho era [1504-1521]. If it is true, his age of death was 10 years younger) one theory has it he was born in 1501.
sen.cmt: スペース追加、the Hojo Godai Ki、the Myoho-ji Kiとし、補足追加、不要なスペースを削除、カッコ表記を修正しました。
sen.e: He died in 1589 at the age of 97, (it is based on the Hojo Godai Ki [Chronicles of the Hojo family through five generations], however, current studied suggest it has many discrepancy between contemporary first class historical materials such as the Myoho-ji Ki [Chronicles of the Myoho-ji Temple] or ancient documents such as old letters, making its credibility doubtful, and Motoki KURODA dated Genan's birth during the Eisho era [1504-1521]. If it is true, his age of death was 10 years younger) one theory has it he was born in 1501.

sen.j: 幻庵の死から8ヵ月後に後北条氏は豊臣秀吉に攻められ滅亡する。
sen.e: The Hojo clan fell,having been attacked by Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI after 8 months of Genan's death.
The Hojo clan fell, having been attacked by Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI after eight months of Genan's death.
sen.cmt: スペース追加、8をスペルアウトしました。
sen.e: The Hojo clan fell, having been attacked by Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI after eight months of Genan's death.

sen.j: 北条氏の長老的性格で、馬術や弓術に優れ、時には一軍を率いて合戦に参加した。
sen.e: He was an elder-like figure of Hoji clan,exceling in Japanese horse-back archery technique and the art of Japanese archery,and joined the battles leading an army sometimes.
He was an elder-like figure of the Hojo clan, exceling in Japanese horse-back archery technique and the art of Japanese archery, and joined the battles leading an army sometimes.
sen.cmt: Hoji clan→the Hojo clanに修正、スペース追加しました。
sen.e: He was an elder-like figure of the Hojo clan, exceling in Japanese horse-back archery technique and the art of Japanese archery, and joined the battles leading an army sometimes.

sen.j: 作法伝奏を業とした伊勢家の後継者として文化の知識も多彩で、和歌・連歌・茶道・庭園などに通じた教養ある人物であった。
sen.e: He had ample knowledge about culture as a successor to the Ise family,whose job was manner denso,and was an educated man,being well versed in such as waka,linked verse,Japanese tea ceremony and garden.

He had ample knowledge about culture as a successor to the Ise family, whose job was manner denso, and was an educated man, being well versed in waka, linked verse, Japanese tea ceremony and garden, etc.
sen.cmt: such as削除、,etc.追加、スペース追加しました。
sen.e: He had ample knowledge about culture as a successor to the Ise family, whose job was manner denso, and was an educated man, being well versed in waka, linked verse, Japanese tea ceremony and garden, etc.

sen.j: 手先も器用であり、鞍鐙作りの名人としても知られ、「鞍打幻庵」とも呼ばれた。
sen.e: He was also dexterous,called as 'saddlesmith Genan',being known as a master of making saddles and armors.
He was also dexterous, called as 'saddlesmith Genan,' being known as a master of making saddles and armors.
sen.cmt: スペース追加、カンマの位置を移動
sen.e: He was also dexterous, called as 'saddlesmith Genan,' being known as a master of making saddles and armors.

sen.j: また、氏康の娘が嫁ぐ際に「幻庵おほへ書」という礼儀作法の心得を記した書を記している。
sen.e: He left a note titled 'Genan memorandum' in which he wrote knowledge of civility and rules of etiquette when Ujiyasu's daughter married.
He left a note titled 'the Genan Memorandum' in which he wrote knowledge of civility and rules of etiquette when Ujiyasu's daughter married.
sen.cmt: Genan memorandum'→'the Genan Memorandum'としました。
sen.e: He left a note titled 'the Genan Memorandum' in which he wrote knowledge of civility and rules of etiquette when Ujiyasu's daughter married.

sen.j: 北条五代の菩提寺である早雲寺の庭園をつくるなど、現在でもその才を偲ぶことができる。
sen.e: We can tell his ability from the garden of Soun-ji temple,which is a family temple of Five Dynasties Period of Hojo.
We can tell his ability from the garden of Soun-ji Temple, which is a family temple of Hojo Godai (the five generations of Hojo).
sen.cmt: templeの頭文字を大文字に変更、スペース修正、Five Dynasties Period of Hojo→Hojo Godai (the five generations of Hojo)としました。(参照: http://books.google.co.jp/books?id=p2QnPijAEmEC&pg=PA252&dq=hojo-godai&hl=ja&ei=nmZzTMGzCIeEuAOdgsG_Dg&sa=X&oi=book_result&ct=result&resnum=1&ved=0CCgQ6AEwAA#v=onepage&q=hojo-godai&f=false)
sen.e: We can tell his ability from the garden of Soun-ji Temple, which is a family temple of Hojo Godai (the five generations of Hojo).

sen.j: 初代北条早雲から5代北条氏直までの全ての当主に仕え、記録の残っている家臣では唯一、後北条氏の最初から最後までを見た人物である。
sen.e: He was the only person who saw from start to end of the Gohojo clan among vassals whose record were left,serving all leaders from the first Soun HOJO to the 5th Ujinao HOJO.
He was the only person who saw from start to end of the Gohojo clan among vassals whose records were left, serving all leaders from the first Soun HOJO to the fifth Ujinao HOJO.
sen.cmt: record→recordsとし、スペース追加、5th→fifthとしました。
sen.e: He was the only person who saw from start to end of the Gohojo clan among vassals whose records were left, serving all leaders from the first Soun HOJO to the fifth Ujinao HOJO.
